title: Ticket #528: BNL schedd periodic expression eval excessively infrequent
description:
The ATLAS group at BNL submit large numbers of Panda pilot jobs with the following job policy: 
LeaveJobInQueue = JobStatus == 4
PeriodicRemove = (JobStatus == 4 && (CurrentTime - EnteredCurrentStatus) > 300)

They report that occasionally, large numbers of jobs in Completed state pile up despite this policy. When I looked at the latest pileup today, they had 29000 jobs in the queue, with roughly 28000 that should have been removed by the PeriodicRemove expression. Some of the jobs had been in Completed state for over 12 hours.

I suspect the Timeslice code is causing the time between periodic expression evaluations to grow excessively when the number of jobs in the queue becomes large.
remarks:
2009-May-27 16:49:41 by jfrey:
As a workaround, I've asked BNL if they can remove the LeaveJobInQueue expression from their jobs.

2009-May-27 16:56:03 by jfrey:
I looked at some BNL logs from yesterday, where the periodic expression evaluation took at least 6.5 minutes to run. The logs rolled, so I don't know when it started. At the default PERIODIC_EXPR_TIMESLICE setting of 0.01, that means the expressions won't be re-evaluated for 650 minutes (11 hours).

2009-May-27 20:17:13 by xzhao:
I asked Torre, and he agrees to remove these policies from the ATLAS panda pilot condor-g submit file.

Xin

2009-May-27 21:18:47 by jfrey:
One reason the evaluation of the periodic expressions took so long at BNL was that PeriodicRemove evaluated to true for many of the jobs. The subsequent removal of the jobs counts as part of the time to evaluate the expressions.

2009-May-29 02:06:47 by danb:
We definitely need to add an upper bound to the periodic expression timeslice interval to prevent insane things like this. I'll do that.

2009-May-29 07:51:52 by tannenba:
Excellent, thanks Dan. Patch committed into the master, gonna resolve this ticket. Note to Jaime - BNL won't get this until we merge the BNL branch back to the master..
